column5: Going back to Wiley Point Lodge - LOTW June 26th - July 6th. Hard to beat the remoteness, fishing and food! Taking the regular Lake Erie guys to Canada this year... nice change of pace after 20+years to Erie.
What's the rush? Some of us haven't gone yet! Nothing like a shield lake in the fall.

Heading to LOTW on Wednesday, in June and in September 2013. Rainy Lake in August 2013. In the state of 10,000 lakes the rest of the year!! I have Eagle Lake, Lac Seul and Red Lake on my to do list, haven't been, but dream about it often!!
Headed to Rainy Friday if all goes well.
Lac Seul Mahkwa Lodge June 28 - July 5Rainy Lake Amik Lodge August 10 - 17
1shooter-nope,no single daughters.Bill
Lac Seul June 22nd - 29th and again in August with dates yet to be determined.

I'll be returning to Pickerel Arm Camp on Minnitaki with my daughter the 3rd week of June.http://i936.photobucket.com/albums/a...r/IMG_7546.jpghttp://i936.photobucket.com/albums/a...r/IMG_7497.jpghttp://i936.photobucket.com/albums/a...IMG_7521-1.jpg
This place.http://www.goldenroute.net/ Can't wait to get back there. Second week of June.

Heading back to Sioux Lookout for our 18th consecutive year. We plan on spending another 10 day trip fishing on Seul, 'Taki, Abrahms, Pelican, plus a number of smaller lakes, and the English and Sturgeon rivers. We arrive with not much of a plan on where to fish and decide on the spot to go where we feel and the conditions merit. No matter what, we always have a great time and always catch a load of fish. We even keep a few eaters for frying at the cabin a several times during the week to enjoy the fruits of our labor. I can hardly wait!

My wife and I are going back to Lac Seul from July 19th to August 10th.We will have a week to ourselves and a week for each daughter and son in law.The daughters and son in laws get a week fishing on Lac Seul as a Christmas present this year.I can hardly wait.Bill

My wife and I will be at Goose Bay Camp June 15-20th. This will be her first trip North! She doesn't fish but she will go out in the boat with me. Some morning jigging, and afternoon trolling/exploring are the plans for now!

Nine of us will be back at Black Bay Outpost on Lac Seul in June. It will be our 29th year there. First week of July we have four couples going to Lost Island Lodge on Lac Seul, 7th year there. Two great spots with awesome fishing and great service from the owners. Mike Kansas
Memorial Day week, which involves pulling some kids from school. Fourth of July/Canada Day week. First full week in August. Labor Day week. All to Lake of the Woods.

We're pushing our trip back to the 3rd week in July, English River at Grassy Narrows. The past 3 years have been the 3rd week in June here, 5 years prior to that was 3rd or 4th week of July.We moved up to 3rd week in June for the past few 3 yrs hoping the fishing would be even better than we are used to up there. I cant say we've done any better in June that we ever did in July and the weather seems a lot more stable in July so we are switching it back going forward.I guess it makes sense, when the weather is 50F and raining 1 day then sunny and 80F the next, it can mess up a the bite to some extent.
I hope to be on Rainy Lake opening week in May! Fingers crossed.
deer horn lodge in june
Birch Dale Lodge on Eagle Lake Sept. 4th-14th for our 25th year!!!! Only 358 days, 17 hours, 22 minutes and 10 seconds to go!!!!!!
Floodwood Lake via Air Cochrane, mid June
Do you have any single daughters?
